Description: RDOS-calc is a clinical decision support application in palliative and critical care, it does not replace the clinical judgment of the caregiver.

Form.Intro: Answer to these {{length}} questions and obtain a pre-diagnostic.

Title.ParadoxicalBreathing: Paradoxical breathing pattern, abdomen moves in on inspiration
Title.NeckUsage: Accessory muscle use, rise in clavicle during inspiration
Title.Grunting: Grunting at end expiration, gutural sound
Title.NasalFlarring: Nasal flarring, involuntary movement of nares at inspiration

RDOS.quote1: For the prediction of a moderate-to-severe dyspnea, the area under the ROC curve was 0.95, with a RDOS cutoff of 4 for 97% sensitivity and 80% specificity.
RDOS.src1: (Campbell ML, et al. Intensity cut-points for the Respiratory Distress Observation Scale. Palliat Med. 2015;29:436-42. Source)
RDOS.quote2: For the prediction of a moderate-to-severe dyspnea, the area under the ROC curve was 0.795, with a RDOS cutoff of 4 for 36% sensitivity and 94% specificity.
RDOS.src2: (Campbell ML, et al. Mild, moderate, and severe intensity cut-points for the Respiratory Distress Observation Scale. Heart Lung. 2017;46:14-17. Source)

IC-RDOS.quote: For the prediction of D-VAS ≥ 4, the area under the ROC curve was 0.83, with a IC-RDOS cutoff of 2.4 for 72% sensitivity and 72% specificity and a cutoff of 6.3 for 100% specificity.
IC-RDOS.src: (Persichini R, et al. Diagnostic Accuracy of Respiratory Distress Observation Scales as Surrogates of Dyspnea Self-report in Intensive Care Unit Patients. Anesthesiology. 2015;123:830-37. Source)

MV-RDOS.quote: For the prediction of D-VAS ≥ 4, the area under the ROC curve was 0.78, with a MV-RDOS cutoff of 2.6 for 57% sensitivity and 94% specificity.
MV-RDOS.src: (Decavèle M, et al. The Mechanical Ventilation-Respiratory Distress Observation Scale as a surrogate of selfreported dyspnoea in intubated patients. Eur Respir J 2018; 52. Source)

About.Desc: This application was developed by the respiratory and critical care team at the Pitié-Salpétrière hospital in Paris to facilitate the calculation of dyspnea observational scales RDOS, IC-RDOS and MV-RDOS. As dyspnea is by definition subjective, these scales do not claim to affirm the presence or absence of dyspnea but offer the possibility to strongly suspect dyspnea in noncommunicative patients in different clinical contexts.
About.DisclaimerText:
The material in this application RDOS-Calc may be used for general informational and educational purposes only. If you use this material, you agree to these terms. If you do not agree to them, do not use the application.
All scores reported in this application are only validated among adults and should not be used in pediatric contexts (see Fortney C, Campbell M.L. Development and Content Validity of a Respiratory Distress Observation Scale-Infant. Journal of palliative medicine. 2020;23: 838-841. Source)
Reference values should not be regarded as absolute indicators of health and disease. Reference intervals should be used with caution, since values for healthy individuals often overlap significantly with values for persons with disease.
